trans-unit.source: Configuring a Virtual Network for Expressroute | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configuring a Virtual Network for Expressroute | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through setting up a virtual network (VNet) for ExpressRoute
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through setting up a virtual network (VNet) for ExpressRoute

trans-unit.source: Configure a Virtual Network for ExpressRoute
trans-unit.target: Configure a Virtual Network for ExpressRoute

trans-unit.source: These steps will walk you through configuring a virtual network and a gateway for ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: These steps will walk you through configuring a virtual network and a gateway for ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the **Management Portal**.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the **Management Portal**.

trans-unit.source: In the lower left-hand corner of the screen, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: In the lower left-hand corner of the screen, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click **Network Services**, and then click **Virtual Network**.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click **Network Services**, and then click **Virtual Network**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Custom Create** to begin the configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Custom Create** to begin the configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the **Virtual Network Details** page, enter the information below.
trans-unit.target: On the **Virtual Network Details** page, enter the information below.

trans-unit.source: **Name** – Name your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – Name your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You’ll use this virtual network name when you deploy your VMs and PaaS instances, so you may not want to make the name too complicated.
trans-unit.target: You’ll use this virtual network name when you deploy your VMs and PaaS instances, so you may not want to make the name too complicated.

trans-unit.source: **Location** – The location is directly related to the physical location (region) where you want your resources (VMs) to reside.
trans-unit.target: **Location** – The location is directly related to the physical location (region) where you want your resources (VMs) to reside.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want the VMs that you deploy to this virtual network to be physically located in East US, select that location.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want the VMs that you deploy to this virtual network to be physically located in East US, select that location.

trans-unit.source: You can’t change the region associated with your virtual network after you create it.
trans-unit.target: You can’t change the region associated with your virtual network after you create it.

trans-unit.source: On the **DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity** page, enter the following information, and then click the next arrow on the lower right.
trans-unit.target: On the **DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity** page, enter the following information, and then click the next arrow on the lower right.

trans-unit.source: **DNS Servers** - Enter the DNS server name and IP address, or select a previously registered DNS server from the dropdown.
trans-unit.target: **DNS Servers** - Enter the DNS server name and IP address, or select a previously registered DNS server from the dropdown.

trans-unit.source: This setting does not create a DNS server, it allows you to specify the DNS servers that you want to use for name resolution for this virtual network.
trans-unit.target: This setting does not create a DNS server, it allows you to specify the DNS servers that you want to use for name resolution for this virtual network.

trans-unit.source: **Configure Site-To-Site VPN** - Select the checkbox for **Configure a site-to-site VPN**.
trans-unit.target: **Configure Site-To-Site VPN** - Select the checkbox for **Configure a site-to-site VPN**.

trans-unit.source: **Select ExpressRoute** – Select the checkbox **Use ExpressRoute**.
trans-unit.target: **Select ExpressRoute** – Select the checkbox **Use ExpressRoute**.

trans-unit.source: This option only appears if you selected ***Configure a Site-to-Site VPN*** in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: This option only appears if you selected ***Configure a Site-to-Site VPN*** in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: **Local Network** - A local network represents your physical on-premises location.
trans-unit.target: **Local Network** - A local network represents your physical on-premises location.

trans-unit.source: You can select a local network that you’ve previously created, or you can create a new local network.
trans-unit.target: You can select a local network that you’ve previously created, or you can create a new local network.

trans-unit.source: If you select an existing local network, skip step 5.
trans-unit.target: If you select an existing local network, skip step 5.

trans-unit.source: If you’re creating a new local network, you’ll see the **Site-To-Site Connectivity** page.
trans-unit.target: If you’re creating a new local network, you’ll see the **Site-To-Site Connectivity** page.

trans-unit.source: If you selected a local network that you previously created, this page will not appear in the wizard and you can move on to the next section.
trans-unit.target: If you selected a local network that you previously created, this page will not appear in the wizard and you can move on to the next section.

trans-unit.source: To configure your local network, enter the following information and then click the next arrow.
trans-unit.target: To configure your local network, enter the following information and then click the next arrow.

trans-unit.source: **Name** - The name you want to call your local (on-premises) network site.
trans-unit.target: **Name** - The name you want to call your local (on-premises) network site.

trans-unit.source: **Address space** - including Starting IP and CIDR (Address Count).
trans-unit.target: **Address space** - including Starting IP and CIDR (Address Count).

trans-unit.source: You can specify any address range as long as it doesn't overlap with the address range for your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can specify any address range as long as it doesn't overlap with the address range for your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: **Add address space** - This setting is not relevant for ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: **Add address space** - This setting is not relevant for ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** You are required to create a local network site for ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** You are required to create a local network site for ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: THe address prefixes specified for the local network site will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: THe address prefixes specified for the local network site will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: Adress prefixes advertised to Microsoft through the ExpressRoute circuit will be used for routing purposes.
trans-unit.target: Adress prefixes advertised to Microsoft through the ExpressRoute circuit will be used for routing purposes.

trans-unit.source: On the **Virtual Network Address Spaces** page, enter the following information and then click the checkmark on the lower right to configure your network.
trans-unit.target: On the **Virtual Network Address Spaces** page, enter the following information and then click the checkmark on the lower right to configure your network.

trans-unit.source: **Address space** - including starting IP and address count.
trans-unit.target: **Address space** - including starting IP and address count.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the address spaces you specify don’t overlap any of the address spaces that you have on your local network.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the address spaces you specify don’t overlap any of the address spaces that you have on your local network.

trans-unit.source: **Add subnet** - including Starting IP and Address Count.
trans-unit.target: **Add subnet** - including Starting IP and Address Count.

trans-unit.source: Additional subnets are not required, but you may want to create a separate subnet for VMs that will have dynamic IP addresses (DIPS).
trans-unit.target: Additional subnets are not required, but you may want to create a separate subnet for VMs that will have dynamic IP addresses (DIPS).

trans-unit.source: Or you might want to have your VMs in a subnet that is separate from your PaaS instances.
trans-unit.target: Or you might want to have your VMs in a subnet that is separate from your PaaS instances.

trans-unit.source: **Add gateway subnet** - Click to add the gateway subnet.
trans-unit.target: **Add gateway subnet** - Click to add the gateway subnet.

trans-unit.source: The gateway subnet is used only for the virtual network gateway and is required for this configuration.
trans-unit.target: The gateway subnet is used only for the virtual network gateway and is required for this configuration.

trans-unit.source: ***Important:*** The gateway subnet for ExpressRoute must be /28 or larger.
trans-unit.target: ***Important:*** The gateway subnet for ExpressRoute must be /28 or larger.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark on the bottom of the page and your virtual network will begin to create.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark on the bottom of the page and your virtual network will begin to create.

trans-unit.source: When it completes, you will see **Created** listed under **Status** on the **Networks** page in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: When it completes, you will see **Created** listed under **Status** on the **Networks** page in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the **Networks** page, click the virtual network that you just created, then click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Networks** page, click the virtual network that you just created, then click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: On the bottom of the Dashboard page, click **CREATE GATEWAY**, then click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom of the Dashboard page, click **CREATE GATEWAY**, then click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: When the gateway starts creating, you’ll see a message letting you know that the gateway has been started.
trans-unit.target: When the gateway starts creating, you’ll see a message letting you know that the gateway has been started.

trans-unit.source: It may take up to 15 minutes for the gateway to create.
trans-unit.target: It may take up to 15 minutes for the gateway to create.

trans-unit.source: Link your network to a circuit.
trans-unit.target: Link your network to a circuit.

trans-unit.source: Proceed with the following instructions only after you have confirmed that your circuit has moved to the following state and status:
trans-unit.target: Proceed with the following instructions only after you have confirmed that your circuit has moved to the following state and status:

trans-unit.source: ServiceProviderState: Provisioned
trans-unit.target: ServiceProviderState: Provisioned

trans-unit.source: Status: Enabled
trans-unit.target: Status: Enabled

trans-unit.source: Verify that you have at least one Azure Virtual Network with a gateway created.
trans-unit.target: Verify that you have at least one Azure Virtual Network with a gateway created.

trans-unit.source: The gateway subnet must be /28 or larger in order to work with an ExpressRoute connection and must be up and running.
trans-unit.target: The gateway subnet must be /28 or larger in order to work with an ExpressRoute connection and must be up and running.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: If you want to add virtual machines to your virtual network, see [How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine](../virtual-machines-create-custom.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to add virtual machines to your virtual network, see [How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine](../virtual-machines-create-custom.md).

trans-unit.source: If you want to learn more about ExpressRoute, see [ExpressRoute Technical Overview](expressroute-introduction.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to learn more about ExpressRoute, see [ExpressRoute Technical Overview](expressroute-introduction.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
